def split_words(txt):
    '''
    Given a string of words, return a list of words split on whitespace, if no whitespaces exists in the text you
    should split on commas ',' if no commas exists you should return the number of lower-case letters with odd order in the
    alphabet, ord('a') = 0, ord('b') = 1, ... ord('z') = 25
    Examples
    split_words("Hello world!") ➞ ["Hello", "world!"]
    split_words("Hello,world!") ➞ ["Hello", "world!"]
    split_words("abcdef") == 3 
    '''    words = []
    words.append(txt)
    words = map(lambda x: x.lower(), words)
    words = map(lambda x: x.count(" "), words)
    words = map(lambda x: x.count(","), words)
    words = map(lambda x: x.count("."), words)
    words = map(lambda x: x.count("_"), words)
    words = map(lambda x: x.count("~"), words)
    words = map(lambda x: x.count("!"), words)
    words = map(lambda x: x.count("?"), words)
    words = map(lambda x: x.count("$"), words)
    words = map(lambda x: x.count("%"), words)
    words = map(lambda x: x.count("^"), words)
    words = map(lambda x: x.count("$"), words)
    words = map(lambda x: x.count("%"), words)
    words = map(lambda x: x.count("^"), words)
    words = map(lambda x: x.count("$"), words)
    words = map(lambda x: x.count("%"), words)
    words

    Given a string of words, return a list of words split on whitespace, if no whitespaces exists in the text you
    should split on commas ',' if no commas exists you should return the number of lower-case letters with odd order in the
    alphabet, ord('a') = 0, ord('b') = 1, ... ord('z') = 25
    Examples
    split_words("Hello world!") ➞ ["Hello", "world!"]
    split_words("Hello,world!") ➞ ["Hello", "world!"]
    split_words("abcdef") == 3 
    '''    # split on whitespace
    words = txt.split()
    # split on commas
    words = [word.lower() for word in words if word.strip()]
    # if no whitespaces exists in the text you should split on commas
    if len(words) == 0:
        words = [word.lower() for word in txt.split(',')]
    # if no commas exists you should return the number of lower-case letters with odd order in the alphabet, ord('a') = 0, ord('b') = 1,...
    else:
        words = [word.lower() for word in words if ord(word) % 2 == 1]
    return words
